org.imageterrier.locfile

Enum PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode>
      • org.imageterrier.locfile.PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode>
    Enclosing class:
    PositionSpec

    public static enum PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode
extends Enum<PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode>
    An enum containing all the supported location payload formats and methods to encode Location objects as integer arrays, and get them back again.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      AFFINE
      Store the theta and tilt parameters from the affine simulation that created the visual term
      AFFINE_INDEX
      Store the index from the affine simulation that created the visual term.
      NONE
      No location information should be stored
      ORI
      Store the orientation of each visual term
      SCALE
      Store the scale of each visual term
      SPATIAL
      Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term
      SPATIAL_AFFINE
      Store the x and y coordinates together with the theta and tilt parameters from the affine simulation that created the visual term
      SPATIAL_SCALE
      Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term together with its respective scale
      SPATIAL_SCALE_ORI
      Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term together with its respective scale and orientation

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int npos
      The number of ordinates stored by the PositionSpecMode

      Decode the ordinates stored in the data array into a Location object.
      protected int encode(double value, double lower, double upper, int nbits)
      Encode value as an nbits UNSIGNED integer

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode NONE
        No location information should be stored

      • SPATIAL

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode SPATIAL
        Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term

      • SCALE

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode SCALE
        Store the scale of each visual term

      • ORI

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode ORI
        Store the orientation of each visual term

      • SPATIAL_SCALE

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode SPATIAL_SCALE
        Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term together with its respective scale

      • SPATIAL_SCALE_ORI

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode SPATIAL_SCALE_ORI
        Store the x and y coordinates of each visual term together with its respective scale and orientation

      • AFFINE

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode AFFINE
        Store the theta and tilt parameters from the affine simulation that created the visual term

      • SPATIAL_AFFINE

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode SPATIAL_AFFINE
        Store the x and y coordinates together with the theta and tilt parameters from the affine simulation that created the visual term

      • AFFINE_INDEX

        public static final PositionSpec.PositionSpecMode AFFINE_INDEX
        Store the index from the affine simulation that created the visual term. Note that the value isn't encoded (as it's already an unsigned integer); the number of bits must however be big enough to store the value in the index however.

        public final int npos
        The number of ordinates stored by the PositionSpecMode

      • encodePosition

        public abstract int[] encodePosition(org.openimaj.feature.local.Location l,
                   int[] positionBits,
                   double[] lowerBounds,
                   double[] upperBounds)
        Encode the Location object as an array of unsigned n-bit integers
        Parameters:
        l - the location to encode
        positionBits - the number of bits for each ordinate
        lowerBounds - the minimum value per ordinate
        upperBounds - the maximum value per ordinate
        Returns:
        an array of integers encoding the ordinates of the Location

      • decodePosition

        public abstract org.openimaj.feature.local.Location decodePosition(int[] data,
                                                 int[] positionBits,
                                                 double[] lowerBounds,
                                                 double[] upperBounds)
        Decode the ordinates stored in the data array into a Location object.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to decode
        positionBits - the number of bits for each ordinate
        lowerBounds - the minimum value per ordinate
        upperBounds - the maximum value per ordinate
        Returns:
        a location object with the ordinates from the data

         double lower,
         double upper,
         int nbits)
        Encode value as an nbits UNSIGNED integer
        Parameters:
        value - value to encode
        lower - minimum allowed value
        upper - maximum allowed value
        nbits - number of bits to use
        Returns:
